intro: Zyrphelis crenata, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped blooms that are typically pink or purple in color. Zyrphelis crenata thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Its foliage is heart-shaped with wavy edges, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
